intro: Acourtia platyptera, commonly known as the flat-leaf acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. Its leaves are broad and flat, which helps it conserve water in arid environments. Acourtia platyptera is a perennial species that thrives in full sun and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
